issues.description: The problem statement and UML refer to a method printFarmSong(), but the template and solution define the method as singFarmSong(). This mismatch in method names can confuse students about which method to implement and how to name it correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the method name across artifacts by renaming either printFarmSong() to singFarmSong() in the problem statement and UML, or renaming singFarmSong() to printFarmSong() in the template and solution.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML refer to a method named `printFarmSong()`, but the template and solution code define this functionality in a method named `singFarmSong()`. Students following the instructions will search for a `printFarmSong` stub that does not exist, causing confusion when mapping requirements to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the method `singFarmSong()` (and its calls) in both the template and solution to `printFarmSong()` to match the problem statement and UML diagram.
